headline: Dr. Oz says he didn't write pro-gun control columns bearing his name
author: Cam Edwards
sentences: Dr. Mehmet Oz continues to show surprisingly strong poll numbers in his bid for the Republican nomination for the U.S. Senate seat currently held by Pat Toomey, especially for a guy who may or may not live in the state and has long taken positions on the Second Amendment that are far more in line with anti-gun activists.

I’d be happy to pose those questions to Oz himself, and my offer to appear on Bearing Arms’ Cam & Co to talk about his positions on some key Second Amendment issues still stands, but so far anyway, when it comes to talking 2A specifics on camera with a knowledgeable interviewer, the doctor’s been out.

I mean, we have plenty of evidence that Oz previously supported gun control, but I’m not aware of any statements he made detailing his gun ownership, even when he was talking about things like red-flag laws on his television show, where it would have made sense to bring it up.

So Oz had nothing to do with the columns, but apparently never saw fit to issue any corrections letting readers know that he completely disagreed with the calls for gun bans and other restrictions on the right to keep and bear arms promoted under his name.

As Fox News details, many of the columns advocated bans on so-called assault weapons, mandatory waiting periods, gun licensing laws, and more, but there’s a catch; Dr. Oz’s colleague says even if the columns ran under his name, he didn’t write them.
